section.para: module enables you to initiate and submit FX transactions to the treasury back office for the FX Spot, FX Forward, and FX Window Forward instruments; enables to add, edit, or release bank payment instructions; processes payment split for FX Spot and FX Forward trades and drawdowns for FX Window Forward trades to support the demands of corporate trading activities, and enables to inquire and generate report for the previously executed FX transactions.
The subsequent sections provides detailed explanation about FX transactions such as deal capturing, pricing, position management, confirmations, accounting, and interfacing.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The following groups of functions are displayed in the menu.

listitem.para: Creates an FX request and submits the request to the treasury back office.

Provides a set of functions for making amendments to a transaction and managing standing instructions attached to the transaction. You can add, edit, and release customer and bank payment instructions, process split on the existing FX Spot and FX Forward trades, process drawdowns on the existing FX Window Forward trades.
Displays all the existing FX transactions submitted by the customer that are awaiting further action from the Bank.
Displays the list of existing FX transactions that are approved by the bank along with the status of the transactions. You can view the details and optionally print a hard copy of these details.
Provides a set of functions to carry out maintenance tasks such as set entity, set references, maintain unsigned, maintain purged, and maintain rejected FX transactions.

The FX Initiation menu provides the following functions to initiate and submit an FX Spot, FX Forward, and FX Window Forward trade request.
FX Spot

section.title: Creating an FX Request
section.para: Using the FX Initiation menu, you can create an FX Spot request as follows:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Deals. In the Deals main menu, under FX Initiation, click FX Spot to create an FX Spot request. The Create a New Foreign Exchange Contract (Spot) page appears.

Enter details in the General Details, Applicant Details, Bank Details, and Request For Quote sections. For more information about the fields in each section, refer to the FX Initiation - FX Spot section.
Click Request to request for the price. To clear the details, click Clear.
If you click Request, the price is either auto-priced or manually specified by the treasury back office trader based on the pricing mechanism configured in the treasury back office.

During the pricing process, a Delay Dialog message is displayed: "Your request is being processed, please wait". To cancel the request, click Cancel. A confirmation message appears. Click Ok. The FX Spot page is displayed with the data specified in the previous request. When the rate pooling is complete, a confirmation message is displayed: Do you want to continue to wait. To continue, click Continue. To cancel, click Cancel. The request is cancelled and the request window is displayed.

When the price pooling is complete, the Contract Details popup window appears. The timer is displayed with an option to Accept or Reject. If you click,
Accept within the specified time limit, the following message is displayed: "You are going to attempt submission of the current transaction. Are you sure?"
If you select Ok before the request expires, then the transaction details are sent to the treasury back office and the trade is moved to the Add Instructions queue.
If you select Ok after the time has expired, then the following message is displayed: "The rate is no longer valid. Your transaction has been refused. If the specified time to accept the price has expired and you select Cancel, then the price request window is displayed. Only the Reject button is enabled.
Reject before or after the time is expired, then the following warning message is displayed: "You are about to reject the request. Are you sure?"
To reject the request, click Yes. The request is rejected and the FX Spot request window is displayed with the values entered in the previous request. You can re-submit the request.
To cancel the request, click Cancel. The Contract Details popup window is displayed. The timer is displayed if the specified time to accept the price has not expired with an option to Accept or Reject the price. If the specified time to accept the price has expired and you click Cancel, then the Contract Details window is displayed. Only the Reject button is enabled. For more information about the Contract Details section, refer to the FX Initiation - Contract Details section.
For more information about the Contract Details section, refer to the FX Initiation - Contract Details section.

When the price is accepted, the transaction is completed and a visual confirmation of the transaction details along with the transaction number is sent to the treasury back office. The following message is displayed in : "Your Foreign Exchange Quote FXxxxxxx has been successfully released to the bank". Click the Review and print the transaction details to view and print the confirmation. The Event Details, General Details, Bank Details, Contract Details, and Settlement Details sections are displayed.
The Settlement Details section is displayed only for the FX Spot trades.

Note: The rates published from the treasury back office are either from the rate source such as Reuters or from the treasury back office database based on the rate source parameter defined in the treasury back office. The published rate is the all-in rate (that is, the spread as defined in the treasury back office). If more than one type of spread such as trading spread, credit spread, and so on is defined, then all the spreads are included in the final rate. If the parameter to verify a trade has been selected in the treasury back office, then the trade must be auto-verified when it is interfaced to the treasury back office.

section.title: Pricing Mechanism
section.para: The price is either auto-priced or manually specified by the treasury back office trader based on the pricing mechanism configuration in the treasury back office. If the pricing mechanism is set to:

listitem.para: Automated pricing: The treasury back office sets the price of the transaction based on the real time market data feed, without manual intervention, and provides it to the customer. However, if the transaction falls outside certain pre-determined parameters (for example, the amount specified in the request exceeds the limit) it is sent to the bank's trader for manual pricing. This leads to delay in returning the price to the user. A message is displayed if manual pricing is taking place or if the pricing request expires. In both the cases, you can choose to continue waiting or stop the request. If you stop the request, sends a message to the treasury back office indicating that the request is cancelled.
Manual pricing: The price is set by the trader. The trader updates the rate and the spread in the back-end system. The applicable price is sent and a message is displayed in .

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para:
This part of the menu contains several functions providing different methods to send a free-format message to the treasury back office. You can add, edit, and release payment instructions; process FX splits; and FX drawdowns using the Message to Bank menu.
Add Instructions
Enables to add settlement instructions for Foreign Exchange transactions.
From Existing FX
Processes payment split for FX Spot and FX Forward transactions and drawdowns for FX Window Forward transactions.
Edit Transactions
Enables to modify and submit the instructions
Retrieve Unsigned
Enables to review and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted to bank due to insufficient privileges

section.title: Message to Bank - Add Instructions
section.para: The Add Instructions function can be used to view all the pending settlement instructions for Foreign Exchange transactions even if one leg of the instruction is pending.

section.title: Add Instructions - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Add Instructions function from the toolbar, select Treasury Services > Deals > Message to Bank, then select Add Instructions from the side left navigation menu. The List of Transactions Awaiting Instructions page appears.

section.title: Add Instructions Selection

section.title: Message to Bank - From Existing FX
section.para: The From Existing FX function enables you to split the original transaction into multiple transactions. The original deal can be split multiple times before the value date of the deal and before the instructions are authorized.

section.title: From Existing FX - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the From Existing FX function from the toolbar, select Treasury Services > Deals > Message to Bank, then select From Existing FX from the side left navigation menu. The List of Existing Foreign Exchange Contracts page appears.

section.title: From Existing FX Selection
section.para: When this function is selected, a list of all the existing Foreign Exchange contracts is displayed. You can select an; FX Spot trade to perform Payment split or an FX Window Forward trade to perform a Drawdown. You can split the existing deal and submit to the treasury back office.

These can be submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities. Click the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter the list. The list of existing FX contracts can be searched by entering search criteria in the System ID, Entity, Bank Ref, Deal Type, CCY, or Ctr CCY fields. The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all the records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns displayed by the From Existing FX function for updating FX transactions are as follows:

You can select the date from the calendar in the adjacent field. If you select Days, then you must specify a valid business day for the entered currency or currency pair. If a date less than today is selected, then the following error message is displayed: Value Date must be greater than or equal to today. The value can be entered in date format or as a pre-defined period (For example, 6 Months or 2 Years). This field is mandatory.

Enter the amount to be split. By default, the deal currency is displayed and disabled. If the payment split or drawdown amount is greater than the original currency amount, then an error message indicating that the payment split or drawdown should be less than or equal to the currency amount is displayed. section.title: Message to Bank - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows you to retrieve, edit, and submit the instructions that are attached to a deal. This option presents a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the treasury back office because the input user either did not submit or had insufficient privileges.

To navigate to the Edit Transactions function from the toolbar, select Treasury Services > Deals > Message to Bank, then select Edit Transactions from the side left navigation menu. The List of Foreign Exchange Draft Transactions page appears.
Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click the System Id column to open the record and edit the information in the Bank Payment Instructions section.
For more information about the Search Options and the fields displayed in the Open Draft Foreign Exchange page, see the Message to Bank - Add Instructions section.

section.title: Message to Bank - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows you to display the Message to Bank records that have not been submitted to the bank due to insufficient privileges. These records are displayed under the Retrieve Unsigned menu. The users who have sufficient privileges to release the instructions can access these records and submit the instructions.

To navigate to the Retrieve Unsigned function from the toolbar, select Treasury Services > Deals > Message to Bank, then select Retrieve Unsigned from the side left navigation menu. The List of Unsigned Foreign Exchange Transactions page appears.

Click the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter the list. The list of unsigned FX contracts can be searched by entering search criteria in the System ID, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Deal Type, or Ccy fields. To display all the records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. The Entity field is displayed only if the customer profile is associated to an entity.

When the required search/filter criteria have been entered, click the Search button to display a list of matching transactions. The columns displayed are as follows: System ID, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Debit Account, Beneficiary Name, Beneficiary Account, Ccy, Amount, Value Date, Deal Type, Input, and Users.
Click the checkbox at the left side of the specific record or multiple records and click Submit to submit the selected records.
Click the System Id column to open a message. The message is non-editable. A user can submit, return, preview, or cancel the FX transactions.
For more information about the fields displayed in the Open Unsigned Foreign Exchange page, see the Message to Bank – Add Instructions section.

section.title: FX Maintenance
section.para: This function is used to maintain FX trade records that were created.

section.title: FX Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: The Set Entity function lists all the Foreign Exchange transactions and associates an Entity with the record. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. You can now associate an entity for the FX trade by clicking the Lookup icon from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: FX Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: The Set Reference function allows you to assign a customer reference to a Foreign Exchange record that currently has none. When you select this option, the List of Foreign Exchange without Customer Reference page appears. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields. You are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form. You can assign a reference to the record.

section.title: FX Maintenance - Unsigned FXs
section.para: The Unsigned FX function lists and optionally deletes unsigned (unauthorized) Foreign Exchange transactions. When you select this option, the Maintenance of Foreign Exchange Unsigned Transactions page appears. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (that is, unauthorized). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box in the left side and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FX Maintenance - Purged FXs
section.para: The Purged FXs function lists and optionally deletes Foreign Exchange transactions that have been marked as Purged by the treasury back office. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. When you select this option, the Maintenance of Foreign Exchange Purged Transactions page appears. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields. You are presented with a list of records. You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box in the left side and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FX Maintenance - Rejected FXs
section.para: The Rejected FXs lists and optionally deletes rejected transactions. When you select this option, the Maintenance of Foreign Exchange Not-issued Transactions page appears. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields. You are presented with a list of Foreign Exchange records that were submitted but rejected by the bank. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. You can delete one or more records in a single operation by placing a tick in the check box in the left side, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
